comments.body: Is this referring to people still using old connection types, or actually supporting people on versions of Ansible <2.7? Because if it is the latter, I don't see why any of this needs to go into the codebase for Ansible 2.8, users of which have by definition upgraded past Ansible 2.7

It's referring to people using old connection types. Before this plugin our modules used another PIP package called pyFMG to manage the connection to Fortimanager. The pyFMG classes were obfuscated by this code in mod_utils/fortimanager.py, and in turn those classes in mod_utils called by older modules. In addition our current modules that have already been PR'd, still need to use this code. Until we PR new versions of existing modules, this code needs to exist.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +301,305 @@
# SOME OF THIS CODE IS DUPLICATED IN THE PLUGIN, BUT THOSE ARE PLUGIN SPECIFIC. THIS VERSION STILL ALLOWS FOR
# THE USAGE OF PYFMG FOR CUSTOMERS WHO HAVE NOT YET UPGRADED TO ANSIBLE 2.7

# LEGACY PYFMG METHODS START
